executiveSummary: Based on analysis of 9 C-suite interviews totaling over 10 hours of conversation, GlueIQ demonstrates emerging AI adoption with significant gaps between leadership aspiration and operational reality. The organization has strong leadership vision (6.5/10) but critically weak AI governance (1.5/10) and strategy alignment (2.5/10). Key themes include: no formal AI transformation plan, no ROI measurement, no ethics governance owner, and a creative team that leads adoption while account/PM teams lag significantly. Identified AI champions (Gaston, Matt K., Casey, Noel, Joey) can serve as change agents. Overall AI maturity score: 3.8/10 (Level 3: Interested). Immediate priorities should focus on formalizing AI strategy, establishing governance, and targeted upskilling.

consensusThemes.name: No Formal AI Plan
quotes: We don't have any plan - Matt Kujawa
No roadmap, no formal strategy - Boris Stojanovic
We haven't formalized anything - Gaston Legorburu

consensusThemes.name: No ROI Measurement
quotes: Not measuring ROI in any structured way - Joey Wilson
Hard to quantify but we know it's helping - Gaston Legorburu

consensusThemes.name: No AI Ethics/Governance Owner
quotes: No one is accountable for AI ethics - Joey Wilson
We need governance but haven't defined it - Chiny Chewing

consensusThemes.name: Reputation Exceeds Capability
quotes: We sell AI transformation but we're not really doing it ourselves - Boris Stojanovic
Reputation exceeds capability in AI - Gaston Legorburu

consensusThemes.name: Creative Team Leads Adoption
quotes: About 75% of creative team is AI fluent - Noel Artiles
Casey and the creative team are ahead - Gaston Legorburu

consensusThemes.name: Account/PM Teams Lagging
quotes: Agency services team - old school in ways of working - Gaston Legorburu
Account team needs to modernize - Maggy Conde

consensusThemes.name: Process Automation Needed
quotes: Workflow automation is our biggest bet - Maggy Conde
Need to automate repetitive deliverables - Joey Wilson

consensusThemes.name: Psychological Safety Concerns
quotes: Organization not a safe space for experimentation - Chiny Chewing
Fear of judgment prevents adoption - Michele Conigliaro

immediate: Designate AI Governance Owner - Assign accountability for AI ethics, data privacy, and tool approval
Document AI Strategy - Create formal AI transformation plan with partner sign-off within 30 days
Empower AI Champions - Activate Gaston, Matt K., Casey, Noel, Joey as formal change leaders
Audit Current AI Usage - Catalog all tools, use cases, and team adoption levels
Establish ROI Framework - Define metrics for measuring AI investment returns
shortTerm: Launch Partner AI Bootcamp - Intensive upskilling for the 5 partners at intermediate level
Standardize AI Tool Stack - Consolidate to approved set of tools with enterprise agreements
Create AI Ethics Policy - Document guidelines for responsible AI use with clients
Automate Top 3 Workflows - Identify and automate most repetitive processes (scope writing, reporting, research)
Modernize Account/PM Tools - Targeted intervention for lagging departments
longTerm: Build AI Center of Excellence - Dedicated resources for AI innovation and support
Achieve 70% AI Fluency - Comprehensive training program for all employees
Implement Agentic Workflows - Build AI agents for routine tasks
Create Psychological Safety - Establish safe experimentation culture
Measure Transformation ROI - Track and report AI impact on efficiency and revenue

high: Reputation Risk - Selling AI transformation while not practicing it internally creates credibility vulnerability
Competitive Risk - Lagging behind industry average (38th percentile) as AI becomes table stakes
Governance Risk - No ethics framework exposes organization to legal and reputational liability
medium: Talent Risk - AI champions may leave if not empowered and supported
Adoption Risk - Inconsistent adoption creates two-tier workforce
Client Risk - Clients increasingly expect AI-native partners
low: Tool Risk - No standardization leads to inefficiency but not critical failure
Cost Risk - AI tool investments without ROI tracking may be questioned
